title: Constructive Draft
description: Un style d'esquisse de design industriel dynamique imitant les marqueurs à alcool et les feutres fins sur papier layout. Caractérisé par des lignes gestuelles assurées, des traits de construction dépassants, des blocs de couleur géométriques audacieux et des reflets blancs marqués.
description_en: A dynamic industrial design sketching style mimicking alcohol-based markers and fine liners on layout paper. Features confident gestural lines, construction 'overshoots', bold geometric color blocking, and stark white highlights to communicate form and material.
description_fr: Un style d'esquisse de design industriel dynamique imitant les marqueurs à alcool et les feutres fins sur papier layout. Caractérisé par des lignes gestuelles assurées, des traits de construction dépassants, des blocs de couleur géométriques audacieux et des reflets blancs marqués.
prompt: A professional industrial design concept sketch of {{subject}}, executed in a mixed media style combining alcohol-based markers (Copic/Prismacolor), fine liner ink pens, and white gouache. The image must be full bleed, edge-to-edge, occupying the entire canvas with no borders or frames. The rendering technique focuses on 'rapid visualization': the line work is energetic and confident, characterized by varying line weights—heavy outer contours to define the silhouette, and thinner internal lines for details. Crucially, include characteristic 'overshoot' lines where strokes extend slightly past intersection points, emphasizing the structural geometry. The {{subject}} is rendered with visible, streaky marker strokes that follow the form, utilizing {{primary_color}} for the main body and neutral cool greys for shading. Lighting is high-contrast studio style, with stark, opaque white gel pen highlights applied to glossy edges and turning points to simulate material reflectivity. Behind the {{subject}}, a bold, graphic rectangle or abstract shape of {{accent_color}}—rendered with vertical marker fill—serves as a backdrop to pop the silhouette forward. The composition includes faint perspective grid lines, construction guides, and handwritten design annotations or callouts scattered artistically around the form. A loose cast shadow, depicted with diagonal hatching or a pool of grey marker, grounds the object on the imaginary plane. The texture mimics the grain and slight absorbency of high-quality marker layout paper. The overall aesthetic is raw, creative, and highly skilled, capturing the essence of a design workshop {{mood}}.
